docs.abstract: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson warned against Chinese and Russian trade in Latin America, while getting more comfortable in his job.
docs.snippet: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson warned against Chinese and Russian trade in Latin America, while getting more comfortable in his job.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ahead of his first trip as secretary of state to South America, Rex W. Tillerson warned countries in the Western Hemisphere on Thursday about the dangers of the region’s growing trade with China and Russia.

headline.main: Before South America Trip, Tillerson Warns Against Trade With China
headline.print_headline: Tillerson Warns Latin America Against Trading With China

docs.abstract: President Trump renewed his attacks against Amazon on Saturday, claiming on Twitter that the Postal Service loses billions of dollars shipping packages for the online giant.
docs.snippet: President Trump renewed his attacks against Amazon on Saturday, claiming on Twitter that the Postal Service loses billions of dollars shipping packages for the online giant.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump renewed his attacks against Amazon on Saturday, claiming on Twitter that the Postal Service loses billions of dollars shipping packages for the online giant. He also accused The Washington Post — which is owned by Jeff Bezos, the chief executive of Amazon — of functioning as a “lobbyist” on behalf of the retailer.

headline.main: The Facts Behind Trump’s Tweets on Amazon, Taxes and the Postal Service
headline.print_headline: Presidential Criticism That Fails to Deliver

byline.original: By Michael Gold and Katie Rogers

docs.abstract: The political action committee founded by John Bolton hired Cambridge Analytica specifically to develop psychological profiles of voters — and it knew the firm was using Facebook data.
docs.snippet: The political action committee founded by John Bolton hired Cambridge Analytica specifically to develop psychological profiles of voters — and it knew the firm was using Facebook data.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The political action committee founded by John R. Bolton, President Trump’s incoming national security adviser, was one of the earliest customers of Cambridge Analytica, which it hired specifically to develop psychological profiles of voters with data harvested from tens of millions of Facebook profiles, according to former Cambridge employees and company documents.

headline.main: Bolton Was Early Beneficiary of Cambridge Analytica’s Facebook Data
headline.print_headline: Bolton’s PAC Reaped Harvest of Facebook Data to Target Voters

docs.abstract: State Senator Chris McDaniel, who nearly unseated Senator Thad Cochran in 2014, appears to have his sights on Senator Roger Wicker in 2018.
docs.snippet: State Senator Chris McDaniel, who nearly unseated Senator Thad Cochran in 2014, appears to have his sights on Senator Roger Wicker in 2018.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — State Senator Chris McDaniel, who nearly beat an incumbent senator in 2014, is expected to announce this week that he will challenge Mississippi’s junior United States senator, Roger Wicker, testing the potency of an anti-establishment message in the Trump era.

headline.main: Mississippi Firebrand Appears Set to Challenge Republican Senator From Right
headline.print_headline: Mississippi Firebrand May Try for Senate

docs.abstract: The president dismissed an idea circulated by some aides and allies that he’d been unhappy with the role of Hope Hicks in workshopping an initial forceful defense of Mr. Porter.
docs.snippet: The president dismissed an idea circulated by some aides and allies that he’d been unhappy with the role of Hope Hicks in workshopping an initial forceful defense of Mr. Porter.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a White House populated by aides who have flamed out, lashed out or cashed out — some do all three in the same day — Hope Hicks, the administration’s communications director, has maintained a low profile as an influential adviser of a mercurial president who prizes her loyalty.

headline.main: As Other Aides Face Trump’s Ire Over Rob Porter’s Departure, Hope Hicks Is Praised
headline.print_headline: At Demanding Workplace, Aide Is Singled Out as ‘Absolutely Fantastic’

docs.abstract: Democrats begged President Trump to seek the extradition of 13 Russians accused of interfering in the 2016 election after Russia’s leader blamed “Jews.”
docs.snippet: Democrats begged President Trump to seek the extradition of 13 Russians accused of interfering in the 2016 election after Russia’s leader blamed “Jews.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Top Democratic leaders in the House and Senate implored President Trump on Monday to employ “all resources available” to extradite 13 Russians charged last month with subverting the 2016 presidential election after Russia’s president raised the possibility of Jewish involvement.

headline.main: After Putin Cites Jews, Democrats Implore Trump to Extradite Russians
headline.print_headline: Putin Mention of Jews Spurs Calls for U.S. to Extradite Russians

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Nicholas Fandos and Matthew Luxmoore

docs.abstract: Kenneth Marcus’s potential return to the Education Department has drawn criticism from civil rights groups that see his narrow focus on Israel as blinding him to other matters of bias.
docs.snippet: Kenneth Marcus’s potential return to the Education Department has drawn criticism from civil rights groups that see his narrow focus on Israel as blinding him to other matters of bias.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Students at the University of Wisconsin-Madison had gathered last spring to consider a resolution calling on the university to divest in companies and countries that abuse human rights, profit from the “military-industrial complex” and promote fossil fuels when the debate jumped the rails.

headline.main: An Advocate for Israel Draws Fire as He Nears Confirmation to Civil Rights Post
headline.print_headline: An Advocate for Israel, Named to a Civil Rights Post, Draws Criticism

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor and Pensions

docs.abstract: Whether it is saber-rattling in the South China Sea, proselytizing on American campuses or censorship of the web, China has alienated one constituency after another.
docs.snippet: Whether it is saber-rattling in the South China Sea, proselytizing on American campuses or censorship of the web, China has alienated one constituency after another.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A few weeks after Stephen K. Bannon left the White House in August, he was invited to a dinner at the Council on Foreign Relations to discuss American policy toward China. With his unbridled China bashing and dark talk of a looming conflict in the Pacific, Mr. Bannon expected to be roughed up by the group, which included China scholars, writers and veterans from past Republican and Democratic administrations.

headline.main: As Xi Tightens His Grip on China, U.S. Sees Conflict Ahead
headline.print_headline: As Xi Tightens Grip on China, Washington Sees Conflict Ahead

docs.abstract: Ms. Hicks, the White House communications director, told lawmakers investigating Russia’s election interference that she has not lied about matters relevant to their inquiry.
docs.snippet: Ms. Hicks, the White House communications director, told lawmakers investigating Russia’s election interference that she has not lied about matters relevant to their inquiry.
docs.lead_paragraph: Update: Hope Hicks announced on Wednesday that she was resigning as White House communications director. For the latest updates and further coverage, read here.

headline.main: Hope Hicks Acknowledges She Sometimes Tells White Lies for Trump
headline.print_headline: In Testimony, Trump Aide Says She’s Lied on the Job

docs.abstract: Last year, he denounced the Persian Gulf state as a “funder of terrorism.” But on Tuesday, the president hosted Qatar’s emir at the White House and praised him as a “great friend.”
docs.snippet: Last year, he denounced the Persian Gulf state as a “funder of terrorism.” But on Tuesday, the president hosted Qatar’s emir at the White House and praised him as a “great friend.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, who last year denounced the Persian Gulf state of Qatar as a “funder of terrorism” and backed its rivals in a contentious regional feud, welcomed its monarch to the Oval Office on Tuesday and portrayed him as a partner in the fight against extremists.

headline.main: Trump Now Sees Qatar as an Ally Against Terrorism
